data.question: What is the main goal of the dirhodium(II)-catalyzed annulation reaction described?
data.answer: The main goal is to furnish the donor–acceptor cyclopropane-fused benzoxa[3.2.1]octane scaffold with excellent chemo-, regio-, and diastereoselectivity under exceptionally mild conditions.

data.question: What are the two structurally different diazocarbonyl compounds used in the annulation reaction?
data.answer: Enoldiazoacetamides and α-diazoketones are the two structurally different diazocarbonyl compounds used.

data.question: Which dirhodium(II) complex provided the best results in terms of yield and selectivity for the annulation product?
data.answer: Rhodium(II) perfluorobutyrate [Rh2(pfb)4] provided the best results, affording the annulation product in 80% isolated yield with excellent cross-selectivity and complete regio- and diastereocontrol.

data.question: True or False: The annulation reaction can only be conducted in chloroform (CHCl3) as the solvent.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the outcome when using copper(I) tetrafluoroborate [Cu-(MeCN)4BF4] as the metal catalyst?
data.answer: Only minor amounts of their respective annulation products were furnished.

data.question: True or False: The annulation products can be transformed into benzoxa[3.3.1]nonane and hexahydronaphthofuran derivatives with exact stereocontrol.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of Rh2(pfb)4 in the reaction mechanism?
data.answer: Rh2(pfb)4 facilitates dinitrogen extrusion from enoldiazoacetamide to form metallo-enolcarbene, which then undergoes intramolecular rearrangement to generate donor-acceptor cyclopropene.

data.question: True or False: The substrate scope investigation showed that all tested enoldiazoacetamides and α-diazoketones were ideal reagents for the reaction.
data.answer: True

data.question: What happens to the annulation product when treated with diisobutylaluminium hydride (DIBAL-H)?
data.answer: Benzoxa[3.3.1]nonane derivatives are formed in high yields with exact stereocontrol.

data.question: True or False: The annulation product is unstable and degrades quickly in open air.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the annulation products bearing highly strained donor–acceptor cyclopropane moieties?
data.answer: They provide further access to benzoxa[3.3.1]nonane and hexahydronaphthofuran derivatives via selective ring opening and rearrangement, important for constructing biologically active natural product skeletons.

data.question: True or False: The reaction mechanism involves a [3++2]-cycloaddition process.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of using tetrahydrofuran (THF) as the solvent in the annulation reaction?
data.answer: Tetrahydrofuran (THF) significantly lowered the reactivity of the annulation reaction.

data.question: True or False: Exceptional regio- and diastereoselectivities were achieved in all cases of the substrate scope investigation.
data.answer: True

data.question: How does the annulation product undergo transformation into hexahydronaphthofuran derivatives?
data.answer: The transformation is induced by tetra-n-butylammonium fluoride (TBAF), furnishing hexahydronaphthofuran derivatives as a single diastereomer.

data.question: True or False: The annulation reaction is not suitable for gram-scale synthesis.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the outcome of combining enoldiazoacetamides with α-diazoketones in the presence of a suitable catalyst?
data.answer: The combination furnishes unique benzoxa[3.2.1]octane scaffolds bearing highly strained donor–acceptor cyclopropane moieties.

data.question: What is the role of dirhodium(II) catalysts in the annulation reaction?
data.answer: Dirhodium(II) catalysts are crucial for achieving compatible reactivity and controllable selectivity between two distinct in situ generated intermediates.

data.question: True or False: The annulation reaction provides a method to construct three natural product-related ring systems efficiently.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the impact of the developed synthetic methodology on organic synthesis?
data.answer: It utilizes two structurally different diazo compounds to efficiently construct three natural product-related ring systems, opening up new possibilities for the application of diazo compounds in organic synthesis.
